ticket.title: App generation attemps to generate app/views/layouts/application.html.erb twice
ticket.original-body:
Ran `rails two_thirty` and got this:
create create README create Rakefile create config.ru create Gemfile create app create app/controllers/application_controller.rb create app/views/layouts/application.html.erb conflict app/views/layouts/application.html.erb Overwrite /home/boris/two_three/app/views/layouts/application.html.erb? (enter "h" for help) [Ynaqdh] y
ticket.latest-body:
Ran `rails two_thirty` and got this:
create create README create Rakefile create config.ru create Gemfile create app create app/controllers/application_controller.rb create app/views/layouts/application.html.erb conflict app/views/layouts/application.html.erb Overwrite /home/boris/two_three/app/views/layouts/application.html.erb? (enter "h" for help) [Ynaqdh] y
ticket.original-body-html:
Ran rails two_thirty and got this:

  create
  create  README
  create  Rakefile
  create  config.ru
  create  Gemfile
  create  app
  create  app/controllers/application_controller.rb
  create  app/views/layouts/application.html.erb
conflict  app/views/layouts/application.html.erb
Overwrite /home/boris/two_three/app/views/layouts/application.html.erb? (enter "h" for help) [Ynaqdh] y

version.body: Can you provide more information please, such as the version of Rails that you're using?
version.body-html: Can you provide more information please, such as the version of Rails that you're using?
version.title: App generation attemps to generate app/views/layouts/application.html.erb twice

version.body: Jesus, my bad! I should know better than that! It was the Rails 3 HEAD version.
version.body-html: Jesus, my bad! I should know better than that! It was the Rails 3 HEAD version.
version.title: App generation attemps to generate app/views/layouts/application.html.erb twice

version.body: Confirmed by amerine on IRC, spastorino says he cannot. I have left a note to future-self to give it a go.
version.body-html: Confirmed by amerine on IRC, spastorino says he cannot. I have left a note to future-self to give it a go.
version.title: App generation attemps to generate app/views/layouts/application.html.erb twice

version.body: Ryan I can't reproduce this using HEAD on 1.8.7 or 1.9.1. Looking at the error message it's got '/home/boris/two_three' as the application root so are you sure it was `rails two_three` that you typed?
version.body-html: Ryan I can't reproduce this using HEAD on 1.8.7 or 1.9.1. Looking at the error message it's got '/home/boris/two_three' as the application root so are you sure it was rails two_three that you typed?
version.title: App generation attemps to generate app/views/layouts/application.html.erb twice

version.body: Yes Andrew i can't reproduce neither and i'm seeing the same as you /home/boris/two_three/app/views/layouts/application.html.erb two_three is not two_thirty. Perhaps Ryan try to reproduce again.
version.body-html:
Yes Andrew i can't reproduce neither and i'm seeing the same as you /home/boris/two_three/app/views/layouts/application.html.erb two_three is not two_thirty.
Perhaps Ryan try to reproduce again.
version.title: App generation attemps to generate app/views/layouts/application.html.erb twice

version.body: Yup, just about to re-install it from head now and attempt it again.
version.body-html: Yup, just about to re-install it from head now and attempt it again.
version.title: App generation attemps to generate app/views/layouts/application.html.erb twice

version.body: Latest head and Ruby version: ruby 1.9.2dev (2010-04-09 trunk 27265) [i686-linux], it's still occurring. Will take a look at this.
version.body-html: Latest head and Ruby version: ruby 1.9.2dev (2010-04-09 trunk 27265) [i686-linux], it's still occurring. Will take a look at this.
version.title: App generation attemps to generate app/views/layouts/application.html.erb twice

version.body: When I looked in the _/usr/local/lib/ruby/gems/1.9.1/gems/railties-3.0.0.beta3/lib/rails/generators/rails/app/templates/app/views/layouts/_ directory I saw there is one _application.html.erb_ and one _application.html.erb.tt_. I nuked my cloned version of Rails and started afresh, and only _application.html.erb.tt_ exists, which makes sense. Giving it a try now.
version.body-html: When I looked in the /usr/local/lib/ruby/gems/1.9.1/gems/railties-3.0.0.beta3/lib/rails/generators/rails/app/templates/app/views/layouts/ directory I saw there is one application.html.erb and one application.html.erb.tt. I nuked my cloned version of Rails and started afresh, and only application.html.erb.tt exists, which makes sense. Giving it a try now.
version.title: App generation attemps to generate app/views/layouts/application.html.erb twice

version.body:
Still can only confirm it. This is what the railties gem contains: http://skitch.com/ryanbigg/n6tbw/boris-borscht-home-boris-rails-railties-lib-rails-generators-rails-app-templates-app-views-layouts-ssh-148x38.
The railties directory inside the cloned repo does not contain this directory, so I think that it's been generated somehow by `rake install`.
version.body-html:
Still can only confirm it. This is what the railties gem contains: http://skitch.com/ryanbigg/n6tbw/boris-borscht-home-boris-rails-rai....

The railties directory inside the cloned repo does not contain this directory, so I think that it's been generated somehow by rake install.
version.title: App generation attemps to generate app/views/layouts/application.html.erb twice

version.body: I don't know how this happened. I removed the railties gem and installed it once more and now it works. Thanks to Santiago for suggesting this.
version.body-html: I don't know how this happened. I removed the railties gem and installed it once more and now it works. Thanks to Santiago for suggesting this.
version.title: App generation attemps to generate app/views/layouts/application.html.erb twice
